reviewTitle: Great Beginner Cross Stitch Kit — Easy to Follow and Kid-Friendly
reviewDescription: This cross stitch kit is a great beginner option, especially for kids. The instructions are easy to follow, and everything needed to get started is included. It’s simple enough for a beginner to work through without feeling overwhelming, which makes it a nice introduction to cross stitch. The materials feel good quality for a starter kit, and it’s been a fun, screen-free activity. Overall, it’s a solid choice for anyone new to cross stitch or looking for a low-pressure craft.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2026

reviewDescription: Wonderful beginner kit. I used a few other colors that are not included in the kit due to customizing the design. Enjoyed these.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2026

reviewTitle: Don't waste the money and hassle to return
reviewDescription: Basically no instructions, fabric and looms did not fit together even with a good amount of force. Spend the extra $5 and get a better product than this.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2026

reviewDescription: Great to help new crosstitchers.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2026

reviewTitle: 10 yr old gamer, sports lover, now cross stitcher too!
reviewDescription: Bought these for my 10yr old son who liked to take over my cross stitching. He loves them simple, quick patterns so he never gets bored of using the same color and pattern all the time. So far, he’s done too, and he’s not slowing down! if your kid likes slime or any kind of tactile activity, they’ll like cross stitching. I’m so glad things like this still exist. Keeps my child from being on electronics all the time.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2026

reviewTitle: Good for young stitchers that are just learning.
reviewDescription: I got these for a younger relative that is just learning how to do cross-stitches and these worked well to help learn the basic cross-stitch and to follow a pattern. They are basic and small patterns, but worked really well for a beginner. It's a good value for what you get and you won't have an over investment if the beginner decides it's not an activity they want to continue doing.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2026

reviewTitle: I love it. Great starter pack
reviewDescription: This is great started pack for beginners. It was easy use and super fun. Would definitely recommend. The template is easy to follow. Also I changed my colors and got creative because I had extra tread.

reviewDescription: I have embroidered for years and this by far is the most disappointing kit I have purchased to date. The hoops are very small, 4 inches across. In need of very nimble fingers. I should have read specific details before I purchased it. The cost is also way above the value.

reviewDescription: I purchased this as a gift for my niece. It comes with items as promised, but the instructions are super -minimalistic : just a few sentences on the 2 stitches to get started. And there is no box. It arrived in a small plastic bag. So, it doesn't really have the appearance of a nice gift. I decided to buy a basic book and a decent box to hold the items, and wrapped that as the gift.

reviewDescription: The small canvas and stamped on design (which promises to come off in water when completed) are ideal for children just learning this craft. reviewDescription: This was my first attempt at cross stitching. Its great for learning. Just watch a few YouTube videos and then dive into these. They vary from very simple lines(the heart) to slightly more complex(the owl) so you can get the hang of different pattern types. The aida cloth used is not the standard 14 count. Its slighty larger. So good for beginning
